question: [File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Composite key ordering] Does the key ordering (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) guarantee correct iterator behavior, or can it cause events to be retrieved in non-deterministic order? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Type: SeqNum] [Sequence overflow] If seq_num reaches u64::MAX, can it wrap around to 0, causing event sequence numbers to collide and overwrite earlier events in the same stream? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Type: Value] [Index validity] Is there validation that the stored Index value is within valid bounds for the transaction's event count, or can out-of-range indices be stored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Atomicity violation] When events are indexed, are both EventByKeySchema and EventByVersionSchema updated atomically, or can partial writes leave indices in inconsistent state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Orphaned indices] If event data is pruned but EventByVersionSchema indices remain, can queries return index pointers to non-existent events, causing lookup failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Duplicate key insertion] Can concurrent transactions inserting events with the same (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) key cause race conditions where one index overwrites another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Version rollback] If a transaction at version V is rolled back, does EventByVersionSchema cleanup all indices for that version, or can stale indices persist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Index corruption on crash] If the node crashes mid-write during event indexing, can RocksDB WAL replay create corrupted or duplicate indices in EventByVersionSchema? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Iterator manipulation] When get_latest_sequence_number uses seek_for_prev with u64::MAX, can an attacker craft entries that cause the iterator to skip over valid events or return wrong sequence numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Range query attack] Can an attacker create events with carefully chosen version and seq_num values that cause range queries (lookup_event_before_or_at_version) to miss events or return wrong results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Key ordering violation] Does the composite key (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) maintain lexicographic ordering correctly, or can specific byte patterns break iterator ordering assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Seek boundary exploit] When seeking with version+1 in lookup_event_after_version, can integer overflow cause seek to wrap to version 0, returning incorrect events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [EventKey collision] Can two different accounts create EventKeys that serialize to identical bytes due to BCS encoding issues, causing their events to be mixed in the index? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Creation number manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate the creation_number in EventKey to create collisions with existing event streams, overwriting or corrupting indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Account address spoofing] Can malicious BCS encoding of account_address in EventKey allow an attacker to create event streams that appear to belong to other accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Sequence gap injection] Can an attacker insert events with non-consecutive sequence numbers, creating gaps that break assumptions in lookup_events_by_key validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Sequence number reuse] If an event stream is deleted and recreated, can old sequence numbers be reused, causing historical indices to point to wrong events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Out-of-order indexing] If events are indexed out of order due to parallel transaction execution, can this violate sequence number continuity assumptions in the schema? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Version monotonicity] Can events be indexed at version V before all events at version V-1 are finalized, creating temporal inconsistencies in the index? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Ledger version bypass] Can queries with ledger_version parameter retrieve events from future versions that shouldn't be visible yet, violating linearizability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Version overflow] If blockchain reaches u64::MAX versions, does version arithmetic in key encoding overflow or wrap, corrupting the index? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [EventByKey divergence] Can EventByVersionSchema and EventByKeySchema become desynchronized, where one has an index entry but the other doesn't, causing lookup failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [EventSchema mismatch] Can indices in EventByVersionSchema point to event positions that don't exist in EventSchema, causing get_event_by_version_and_index to fail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [TranslatedV1Event conflict] When V2 events are translated to V1, can this create duplicate entries in EventByVersionSchema with same (key, version, seq_num) but different indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Partial pruning] In prune_event_indices, if deletion of EventByVersionSchema entries fails mid-operation, can this leave dangling indices that reference pruned events? (High)
